content: Why does Oort DSS recommend exercising caution when making a bucket public?

content: What is the maximum size of a file that you can upload with the Oort DSS console?

content: What are the advantages of using multipart upload in Oort DSS?
summary: Using multipart upload in Oort DSS provides several advantages. It improves throughput as you can upload parts in parallel. It provides quick recovery from any network issues as smaller part size minimizes the impact of restarting a failed upload. It allows you to pause and resume object uploads, and you can upload an object as you are creating it. Also, if you're uploading large objects over a stable high-bandwidth network, multipart upload maximizes the use of your available bandwidth by uploading object parts in parallel for multithreaded performance.

content: Which type of storage class in Oort DSS allows for the immediate download of objects?

content: How can I delete all objects in a specific folder in my bucket?
summary: You can use the 'rclone delete' command followed by the path of the folder in your bucket. For example, 'rclone delete dss-remote:mybucket/photos/'.

content: Why does Oort DSS replace the existing object if you upload an object with a key name that already exists in a versioning-disabled bucket?
summary: Oort DSS replaces the existing object if you upload an object with a key name that already exists in a versioning-disabled bucket to ensure that the bucket contains the most recent version of the object. If versioning were enabled, Oort DSS would keep all versions of an object, but in a versioning-disabled bucket, only one version can exist, so the new upload overwrites the existing object.

content: What is the process to manage my billing information in Oort DSS?

content: How does Oort DSS support the folder concept?
summary: For the sake of organizational simplicity, the Oort DSS console supports the folder concept as a means of grouping objects. It does this by using a shared name prefix for objects (that is, objects have names that begin with a common string). Object names are also referred to as key names.

content: Why does Oort DSS pause accounts with unpaid bills?

content: What happens when a shard is not available due to node failure or network congestion in Oort DSS?
summary: In Oort DSS, if a shard is not available due to node failure or network congestion, the file can still be reassembled and decrypted. This is possible due to the erasure coding technology, which generates additional parity shards that provide redundancy and allow the file to be reconstructed.

You will then be prompted to enter your credentials, including your access key and secret key. You can also specify the endpoint for Oort DSS and choose the default ACL (private).

content: Any APIs for developers to operate files on DSS?
summary: Yes, DSS provides a S3-Compatible API for developers to operate files. The API supports basic data access model of the Amazon S3 API. The API endpoint URL for standard storage is https://s3-standard.oortech.com and for archive storage is https://s3-archive.oortech.com. The API supports AWS v4 signature (AWS4-HMAC-SHA256) for authentication and maintains strict https-only standards. The effective rate limit of the API is 100 RPS (requests per second). Moreover, DSS also supports pre-signed URLs for downloading and uploading objects, which can be generated in several ways, including the AWS CLI and AWS SDKs.

content: How do I calculate the cost of 50TB archive storage?
summary: To calculate the cost of 50 Terabytes of archive storage on DSS, you would follow these steps: 1. Determine the amount of storage you plan to use. In this case, it's 50 TB. 2. Subtract the amount of free storage provided by DSS. According to the document, DSS provides 1TB (or 1,000 GB) of free archive storage. Since 50TB is more than the free tier, you would subtract 1TB from 50TB, which leaves 49TB. 3. Multiply the remaining amount of storage by the cost per GB for archive storage. According to the document, the cost of archive storage is $0.0014 per GB. So, the cost would be 49TB * 1,000 (to convert to GB) * $0.0014 = $68.60.

content: What is the role of the entity tag (ETag) in the multipart upload process in Oort DSS?
summary: Whenever you upload a part in Oort DSS, it returns an entity tag (ETag) header in its response. For each part upload, you must record the part number and the ETag value. You must include these values in the subsequent request to complete the multipart upload.

content: What is the purpose of the ETag header in Oort DSS?
summary: In Oort DSS, when you upload a part, the service returns an entity tag (ETag) header in its response. For each part upload, you must record the part number and the ETag value. The ETag value is used to ensure the integrity of the data transfer, and it is required to complete the multipart upload.

content: Tell me about the multipart upload API operation.

content: Why is the multipart upload API operation designed to improve the upload experience for larger objects?
summary: The multipart upload API operation is designed to improve the upload experience for larger objects because it allows for the object to be broken into smaller parts for upload. These parts can be uploaded independently, in any order, and in parallel, which can enhance upload speed, provide better error recovery, and offer more flexibility and control during the upload process.

content: When should I consider using multipart uploads in Oort DSS?
summary: In general, when your object size reaches 100 MB, you should consider using multipart uploads instead of uploading the object in a single operation. Multipart upload allows you to upload a single object as a set of parts. Each part is a contiguous portion of the objects data. You can upload these object parts independently and in any order. If transmission of any part fails, you can retransmit that part without affecting other parts.

content: Which technique is used after encryption in Oort DSS?
summary: After encryption, the file in Oort DSS is processed using a technique called erasure coding, such as polar code and LDPC code. This process generates additional parity shards, which provide redundancy and allow the file to be reconstructed even if some shards are lost or unavailable.

content: Which type of keys are used to authenticate requests in Oort DSS?

content: Which elements does an object in Oort DSS consist of?

content: Where can you find the information about the impact of stopping a multipart upload in Oort DSS?
summary: In Oort DSS, if you stop a multipart upload, you cannot upload any part using that upload ID again. If any part uploads were in-progress, they can still succeed or fail even after you stop the upload. To make sure you free all storage consumed by all parts, you must stop a multipart upload only after all part uploads have been completed.

content: What are Oort credits and how can I add them?
summary: Oort Credits are a simple and flexible way to pay for the data services you need. When you upgrade to pay-as-you-go rates, youll receive a monthly bill and use Oort Credits to pay for the services youve used. Any outstanding balance will be charged to the credit card on record. These credits will be automatically deducted from your account to pay for your monthly bills once the invoice is issued. To add Oort Credits to your account, log in to your Oort DSS account and navigate to the Dashboard or the billing section. From there, select the option to add Oort Credits. You can then choose the amount of credits you want to purchase and select your preferred payment method. Oort DSS accepts all major credit and debit cards, so you can easily purchase credits using your preferred payment method. Once your payment is processed, the credits will be added to your account balance, ready for you to use to pay for your data services.

content: How can I use access keys to sign programmatic requests to the AWS CLI or Oort DSS S3-Compatible API?
summary: Access keys consist of an access key ID and a secret access key. You must use both the access key ID and secret access key together to authenticate your requests. When you create an access key pair, save the access key ID and secret access key in a secure location. The secret access key is available only at the time you create it.

content: Why is an object key important in Oort DSS?
summary: An object key in Oort DSS uniquely identifies the object in a bucket. When users create an object, they specify the key name, which is used to retrieve the object later. This ensures that each object can be uniquely identified and accessed.

content: Who is affected if there is an unpaid bill in Oort DSS?
summary: If there is an unpaid bill in Oort DSS, the user's account will be paused until the outstanding balance is settled. Additionally, if the user has not taken any action on their account for more than 15 days, all their data will be permanently deleted.

content: Where can I add Oort credits in Oort DSS?
summary: To add Oort credits in Oort DSS, log in to your account and navigate to the Dashboard or the billing section. From there, select the option to add Oort Credits. You can then choose the amount of credits you want to purchase and select your preferred payment method. Once your payment is processed, the credits will be added to your account balance.

content: Who receives a notification when the restoration of an object from archive storage in Oort DSS is complete?
summary: The user who initiated the restoration of an object from archive storage in Oort DSS receives a notification when the restoration is complete. From there, they can download the object as they would with a standard storage class object.

content: What command is used to upload a single file to a bucket on Oort DSS using the AWS CLI?
summary: To upload a single file to a bucket on Oort DSS using the AWS CLI, you can use the following command: 'aws endpoint httpss3standardoortechcom s3 cp filename s3bucketname'. For example, to upload a file named 'myphotopng' to the bucket 'mybucket', you would use 'aws endpoint httpss3standardoortechcom s3 cp Photosmyphotopng s3mybucket'.

content: Who can download an object from a standard storage class bucket in Oort DSS?
summary: Any user with the appropriate permissions can download an object from a standard storage class bucket in Oort DSS. The user would need to navigate to the bucket where the object is located, locate the object they want to download, right-click on its name, and click on the 'Download' button to initiate the download.

content: What is the purpose of the 'aws endpoint httpss3standardoortechcom s3 rm recursive s3bucketname' command in the context of AWS CLI and Oort DSS?
summary: The 'aws endpoint httpss3standardoortechcom s3 rm recursive s3bucketname' command is used to delete all files in a bucket on Oort DSS using the AWS CLI. This command recursively removes all objects within the specified bucket.

content: Tell me what happens when a folder is uploaded to Oort DSS.
summary: When a folder is uploaded to Oort DSS, all of the files and subfolders from the specified folder are uploaded to the bucket. The system then assigns an object key name that is a combination of the uploaded file name and the folder name.

content: Who can download the Rclone tool?
summary: Any user who needs to sync their files from other cloud services to Oort DSS can download the Rclone tool. The tool is available for download from the official Rclone website.

content: Which are the constraints for a bucket name?
summary: Bucket names must be between 3 (min) and 63 (max) characters long, must begin and end with a letter or number, must be unique, and a bucket name cannot be used by another Oort account until the bucket is deleted.

content: When can you provide your security credentials in Oort DSS?
summary: You can provide your security credentials in Oort DSS when you are creating a temporary authorized link. Your credentials are used to grant time-limited permission to download the object.

content: When using the multipart upload API operation, what size of objects can you upload?
summary: When using the multipart upload API operation, you can upload objects from 5 MB to 5 TB in size.

content: Which feature in Oort DSS allows users to initiate a batch download of multiple objects from a standard storage class bucket?
summary: In Oort DSS, users can select multiple objects and click on the 'Download' button at the top of the page to initiate a batch download of multiple objects from a standard storage class bucket.

content: What is the default expiration time for a presigned S3 URL generated using the AWS CLI?
summary: By default, the expirationtime for a presigned S3 URL generated using the AWS CLI is one hour. However, you can specify different expiration times by adding flags and minutes 'expiresin'.

content: What is the process to upload a website in Oort DSS?
summary: To upload a website in Oort DSS, you first need to sign up for an account and create a storage bucket in the Oort DSS console. Then, you can open a bucket of choice in your Oort DSS console and choose the bucket you want to upload. Finally, you can drag your website project folder or select your website project folder to upload.

content: Who can upload the object parts in a multipart upload in Oort DSS?
summary: The person who initiated the multipart upload or anyone with the necessary permissions can upload the object parts in a multipart upload in Oort DSS. These parts can be uploaded independently and in any order.

content: Who can use Rclone to restore and decrypt files from cloud storage?
summary: Any user who has previously backed up and encrypted files to cloud storage using Rclone can use the tool to restore and decrypt those files.

content: Where can you find the latest version of Rclone?
summary: For the latest version of Rclone, downloading from rclone.org is recommended.

content: What does the 'CreateMultipartUpload' API method do?
summary: The 'CreateMultipartUpload' API method initiates a multipart upload and returns an upload ID. This upload ID is used to associate all of the parts in the specific multipart upload.

content: What does the 'CopyObject' API method do?
summary: The 'CopyObject' API method creates a copy of an object that is already stored in the storage service.

content: How is the price calculated for data egress in Oort DSS?
summary: In Oort DSS, the price for data egress is not explicitly mentioned in the document. However, users can sign up for a free trial with no time limit and receive 20GB of standard data storage, 1TB of archive storage, and 5GB of data egress per month for free. For more storage or data egress, users can upgrade to pay-as-you-go rates.

content: How can you share an object in Oort DSS with someone who does not have access to your bucket?
summary: You can share an object in Oort DSS with someone who does not have access to your bucket by creating a temporary authorized link for the object. This link grants time-limited permission to download the object.

content: Why should you consider using multipart uploads in Oort DSS?
summary: You should consider using multipart uploads in Oort DSS when your object size reaches 100 MB. Multipart upload allows you to upload a single object as a set of parts, which can be uploaded independently and in any order. This provides several advantages such as improved throughput, quick recovery from network issues, the ability to pause and resume object uploads, and the ability to begin an upload before you know the final object size.

content: What is the purpose of the ACL in the context of this document?
summary: The ACL (Access Control List) is used for creating objects and, if not set for buckets, for creating buckets too. It is applied when server-side copying objects as the service doesn't copy the ACL from the source but rather writes a fresh one.

content: How can one manage expenses using Oort credits?
summary: By using Oort Credits, you can easily manage your expenses and pay only for the services you need, without worrying about complex payment processes or upfront fees.

content: What is the similarity in the configuration process for other cloud storage providers?
summary: The configuration process for other cloud storage providers is similar to the main ones like Google Cloud, Amazon Web Services (AWS), Alibaba Cloud, Tencent Cloud, etc. You can refer to the configuration steps of the main providers for your own configuration.

content: Where can I find information about the low credit alert feature in Oort DSS?
summary: Information about the low credit alert feature in Oort DSS can be found in the billing section. The low credit alert feature allows you to set a specific credit threshold, and you'll be notified if your balance falls below that threshold. This way, you can top up your account before your credits run out and avoid any service interruptions.

content: Who is responsible for the reassembly and decryption of the file in Oort DSS?
summary: The user's client-side application is responsible for the reassembly and decryption of the file in Oort DSS. After the application requests the shards from the corresponding nodes and receives them, it can reassemble and decrypt the file.

content: What is the design of Oort DSS?
summary: Oort DSS is designed as a decentralized system with no central authority that controls the data. This design makes it resistant to censorship and single points of failure. The source code of DSS will be open in the future, which allows anyone to review the code and contribute to the project.

content: What is the purpose of the 'UploadPart' API method in Oort DSS?
summary: The 'UploadPart' API method in Oort DSS is used to upload a part in a multipart upload.

content: Why does Oort DSS allow a maximum of ten access keys?
summary: Oort DSS allows a maximum of ten access keys to facilitate the management of user access and maintain security. This limit allows you to rotate the active keys according to best practices, ensuring that even if one key is compromised, it can be replaced without disrupting all operations.

content: Where can users find the creation time of an object in Oort DSS?
summary: Users can find the creation time of an object in Oort DSS on the object detail page. This page provides key information about the object, including its creation time.

content: Where can I upload any type of file in Oort DSS?
summary: You can upload any type of fileвЂ”images, backups, data, movies, etc.вЂ”into an Oort DSS bucket.

summary: One can upload a website project folder to a bucket in Oort DSS at any time by dragging the website project folder or selecting the website project folder to upload.

content: Where is the data controlled in the Oort DSS process?
summary: In the Oort DSS process, the data is not controlled by any central authority. This decentralized design makes it resistant to censorship and single points of failure.

content: When should I enter the access key ID and secret access key when using the Oort DSS S3-Compatible API?
summary: When using the Oort DSS S3-Compatible API, you need to enter both the access key ID and secret access key in the API request. These are used to sign programmatic requests to the API.

content: When does Oort DSS assemble the parts of an object during a multipart upload?
summary: Oort DSS assembles the parts of an object and creates the object after all parts of your object are uploaded and you complete the multipart upload. Upon receiving the complete multipart upload request, Oort DSS constructs the object from the uploaded parts.

content: Tell me what happens when a folder with multiple files is uploaded to Oort DSS.
summary: When a folder with multiple files is uploaded to Oort DSS, all of the files and subfolders from the specified folder are uploaded to the bucket. The system then assigns an object key name that is a combination of the uploaded file name and the folder name.

content: Where can you host a website that requires scalability to handle occasional traffic spikes?
summary: You can host a website that requires scalability to handle occasional traffic spikes on a decentralized network like Oort DSS. Static Website Hosting on Oort DSS is best for such websites.

content: How can I delete a bucket in DSS?
summary: Before deleting a bucket in DSS, you should first empty it or delete its objects. After you delete a bucket, the name becomes available to reuse. However, another Oort account could create a bucket with the same name before you have a chance to reuse it.

content: How can you sync your files from other clouds to Oort DSS?
summary: You can sync your files from other clouds (AWS, Google Cloud, Azure Cloud, etc.) to Oort DSS using the Rclone tool. Rclone is a command-line program to manage files on cloud storage. It supports over 40 cloud storage products, including S3 object stores, business & consumer file storage services, as well as standard transfer protocols.

content: What should I do if I'm asked to enter a value for 'secret_access_key' during the setup?
summary: If you're asked to enter a value for 'secret_access_key' during the setup, you should enter your secret access key. If you want to leave it empty, you can simply press Enter.

content: What does the Object Details page in Oort DSS provide you with in terms of data management?
summary: The Object Details page in Oort DSS provides you with the tools you need to manage your data effectively. It gives you access to key information about the object and a visual representation of the location of your data, allowing you to have greater control and transparency over where your data is being stored.

content: Which nodes in Oort's infrastructure ensure data durability and resilience against data loss?
summary: Backup Nodes in Oort's infrastructure ensure data durability and resilience against data loss due to hardware or network failures. They are deployed globally and utilize the storage capacity of popular decentralized storage networks.

content: When will I be charged for the services I use in Oort DSS?
summary: Oort DSS offers a pay-as-you-go pricing model where you only pay for the services you use. At the beginning of each month, your invoice will be automatically charged to your Oort Credits balance. If you have sufficient credits, the payment will be processed seamlessly. However, if you dont have enough credits to cover your invoice, youll need to add more credits to your account and complete the payment manually.

content: Where can you find information about the data durability and resilience against data loss in Oort DSS?
summary: Information about data durability and resilience against data loss in Oort DSS can be found in the 'Storage providers' section of the user guide. It explains that all user data stored on Oort is backed up by Backup Nodes, ensuring data durability and resilience against data loss due to hardware or network failures.

content: Where is the shard IP-based distribution recorded in the Oort DSS process?
summary: In the Oort DSS process, the shard IP-based distribution is recorded in the decentralized database system in Oort.

content: What is the DSS API?
summary: The DSS API is a set of protocols for programmatically interacting with DSS. You can use it to create, configure, and manage DSS resources.

content: Why is it beneficial to host your website on a decentralized network like Oort DSS?
summary: Hosting your website on a decentralized network like Oort DSS is beneficial because it offers superior performance, technical resiliency, and privacy at a fraction of the cost of traditional centralized options. Additionally, Oort DSS provides full control of your data and easy maneuverability of your custom domains with zero downtime.

content: How does Oort DSS handle the retrieval of files in the event of node failure or network congestion?
summary: In the event of node failure or network congestion, Oort DSS can still reassemble and decrypt the file. This is possible due to theerasure coding technology used in the system, which generates additional parity shards. These provide redundancy and allow the file to be reconstructed even if some shards are not available.

content: Why might the download of an object from Oort DSS take some time to complete?
summary: The download of an object from Oort DSS might take some time to complete depending on the size of the object. Larger objects will take longer to download due to the larger amount of data that needs to be transferred from the Oort DSS servers to the user's local device.

summary: To manage your payments in Oort DSS, navigate to the billing section of the console. From the sidebar menu, select 'Billing,' and you'll be redirected to the Oort Billing portal. Here, you can view and manage all of your bills, payments, and payment methods in one place.

content: What does the live map on the Object Details page in Oort DSS show?
summary: The live map on the Object Details page in Oort DSS shows how the object is being stored on different nodes across the globe. This provides users with a visual representation of the location of their data.

content: Where can I find the access keys in Oort DSS?

summary: In Oort DSS, both the access key ID and secret access key are used together for authentication purposes when making programmatic requests to work with resources in your account. Like a username and password, you must use both the access key ID and secret access key together to authenticate your requests.

content: When can you download an object from a standard storage class bucket in Oort DSS?
summary: In Oort DSS, you can download an object from a standard storage class bucket after you locate the object you want to download, right-click on its name, and click on the 'Download' button to initiatethe download.

content: When should you consider using Oort DSS for hosting a dynamic website?
summary: You should consider using Oort DSS for hosting a dynamic website when you need to use multiple web servers in at least two data centers, need to scale with load balancing, auto-scaling, or external databases, require sustained high CPU utilization, or require maximum control and flexibility in web server configuration and management.

content: What is the benefit of restoring objects from archive storage in Oort DSS?
summary: The benefit of restoring objects from archive storage in Oort DSS is that it provides a cost-effective way to store infrequently accessed data. However, it's important to remember that the restoration process can take some time.

content: What is the purpose of the 'region' option?
summary: The 'region' option is used to specify the region to connect to. It can be left blank if you are using an S3 clone and you don't have a region.

content: Who can share a private video in a bucket in Oort DSS?
summary: The object owner in Oort DSS can share a private video in a bucket by generating a temporary authorized link. This link can then be shared with others to provide them with access to the video.

content: How does the decentralized nature of Oort DSS benefit users?
summary: The decentralized nature of Oort DSS benefits users by providing a system with no central authority that controls the data, making it resistant to censorship and single points of failure.

content: Tell me how the multipart upload API operation improves the upload experience.
summary: The multipart upload API operation improves the upload experience for larger objects by allowing you to upload an object in parts. These parts can be uploaded independently, in any order, and in parallel. This flexibility can improve upload speed and reliability.

content: Which process is similar for other cloud storage providers to the main ones in terms of configuration?
summary: The configuration process for other cloud storage providers is similar to the main ones like Google Cloud, Amazon Web Services (AWS), Alibaba Cloud, and Tencent Cloud.

content: Why should you use multipart upload if you're uploading over a spotty network in Oort DSS?
summary: If you're uploading over a spotty network in Oort DSS, you should use multipart upload to increase resiliency to network errors. If transmission of any part fails, you can retransmit that part without affecting other parts, avoiding the need to restart the entire upload.

summary: Decentralized website hosting, like the one offered by Oort DSS, allows you to enjoy full control of your data and the easy maneuverability of your custom domains with ZERO downtime.

content: Where can you find information about the Pay-as-you-go rates in Oort DSS?
summary: Information about the Pay-as-you-go rates in Oort DSS can be found in the 'Pricing' section of the user guide. If users require more storage or data egress, they can easily upgrade to pay-as-you-go rates.

summary: Oort DSS offers low credit alerts to help you avoid service interruptions.

content: How is the cost for archive storage calculated in Oort DSS?
summary: The cost for archive storage in Oort DSS is calculated based on the amount of data you store. The rate is $0.0014 per GB per month. Objects stored less than 90 days will be calculated as 90 days.

content: What can be shared using a temporary authorized link in Oort DSS?
summary: Using a temporary authorized link in Oort DSS, you can share any object stored in your bucket. This could be a video, an image,a document, or any other type of file.

content: Where do you specify the bucket name when deleting all files in a bucket in Oort DSS using AWS CLI?
summary: When deleting all files in a bucket in Oort DSS using AWS CLI, you specify the bucket name in the 'aws s3 rm --recursive' command. For example, 'aws s3 rm --recursive s3://mybucket' would delete all files from the bucket 'mybucket'.

content: Where can you find the entity tag (ETag) header in Oort DSS?
summary: In Oort DSS, whenever you upload a part, Oort DSS returns an entity tag (ETag) header in its response. This ETag is used to identify the part in subsequent operations, such as completing the multipart upload.

content: Why do you need to use the 'aws s3 cp' command to upload a single file to Oort DSS using the AWS CLI?
summary: You need to use the 'aws s3 cp' command to upload a single file to Oort DSS using the AWS CLI because 'cp' stands for 'copy'. This command copies a local file to a specified bucket in Oort DSS. The command requires the filename and the bucket name to perform the operation.

content: How can one create a folder in a bucket in Oort DSS?
summary: To create a folder in a bucket in Oort DSS, sign in to Oort DSS Console and in the Buckets list, choose the name of the bucket that you want to create a folder in.

content: Where is the file processed using erasure coding in the Oort DSS process?
summary: In the Oort DSS process, after encryption, the file is processed using a technique called erasure coding, such as polar code and LDPC code. This process generates additional parity shards which provide redundancy and allow the file to be reconstructed even if some shards are lost or unavailable.

content: I need to know what the live map on the Object Details page in Oort DSS shows.
summary: The live map on the Object Details page in Oort DSS shows how the object is being stored on different nodes across the globe. This provides a visual representation of the location of your data and gives you greater control and transparency over where your data is being stored.

content: When can you use Rclone to mount multiple encrypted, cached, or diverse cloud storage as a disk in Oort DSS?
summary: You can use Rclone to mount multiple encrypted, cached, or diverse cloud storage as a disk in Oort DSS whenever you need to access multiple cloud storages as if they were local disks. This can be useful for managing and accessing data across multiple cloud platforms.

content: Why does the user need to select the object they want to download from an archive storage class bucket in Oort DSS?
summary: The user needs to select the object they want to download from an archive storage class bucket in Oort DSS because the system needs to know which specific object to restore. By selecting the object, the user is telling the system exactly what data to retrieve from the archive storage and make available for download.

content: How do you receive a notification that an object is available for download in Oort DSS?

content: When DSS uses the PoH consensus, what is the role of this consensus mechanism?
summary: When DSS uses the PoH consensus, this consensus mechanism plays a crucial role in guaranteeing the integrity and availability of the stored shards on the nodes. Nodes that successfully deliver the requested shards and meet the service level agreement are rewarded.

content: What is the default access level for all Oort DSS objects?
summary: By default, all Oort DSS objects are private. Only the object owner has permission to access them.

content: When can I store objects in Oort DSS?

content: Where can I find the naming rules for buckets in Oort DSS?
summary: The naming rules for buckets in Oort DSS are as follows: Bucket names must be between 3 (min) and 63 (max) characters long. Bucket names can consist only of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens (-). Bucket names must begin and end with a letter or number. Bucket names must be unique. A bucket name cannot be used by another Oort account until the bucket is deleted.

content: What is the significance of the Object Details page in Oort DSS?
summary: The Object Details page in Oort DSS provides users with a comprehensive view of the object theyre storing in the platform. One of the most important features of the Object Details page is the live map, which shows how the object is being stored on different nodes across the globe.

content: When is dynamic website hosting best?
summary: Dynamic website hosting is best for websites using multiple web servers in at least two data centers, websites that need to scale with load balancing, auto-scaling, or external databases, websites that require sustained high CPU utilization, and clients that require maximum control and flexibility in web server configuration and management.

content: How does hosting on a decentralized network differ from hosting on a big brand?
summary: Hosting on a decentralized network like Oort DSS offers several advantages over traditional big brand hosting services. content: What is the difference between OORTDSS and IPFS in terms of purpose?
summary: OORTDSS is designed primarily as a decentralized cloud storage platform, aiming to provide an enterprise-grade, secure, private, and cost-effective alternative to traditional centralized cloud storage services. On the other hand, IPFS is a distributed file system that aims to make the web faster, safer, and more open. It seeks to replace the traditional centralized model of the internet with a peer-to-peer protocol where each user acts as both a client and a server, sharing and accessing content with others in the network.

content: How can you generate presigned URLs for downloading and uploading objects in Oort DSS?

content: Why is Rclone used to manage files on cloud storage?

Rclone has powerful cloud equivalents to the unix commands rsync, cp, mv, mount, ls, ncdu, tree, rm, and cat.

content: How is the pay-as-you-go pricing structured in Oort DSS?
summary: Oort DSS offers a flexible payment model where you only pay for the services you use. There are no upfront fees or minimum storage requirements, so you can customize your plan to fit your specific needs. Your bill is based on three factors: the amount of data you store and how long you keep it in the Standard storage class, the amount of data you store in the Archive storage class (objects stored less than 90 days will be calculated as 90 days), and the amount of data you transfer out of Oort DSS.

content: How does Oort DSS handle the hosting of websites that use multiple web servers in at least two data centers?

This requires a hosting solution that can efficiently manage multiple servers across different locations.

content: What technique is used after encryption in Oort DSS?
summary: After encryption, the file in Oort DSS is processed using a technique called erasure coding, such as polar code and LDPC code. This process generates additional parity shards, which provide redundancy and allow the file to be reconstructed even if some shards are lost or unavailable.

summary: The validity of temporary authorized links in Oort DSS is determined by the specified duration. However, if you created a temporary authorized link using a temporary token, then the URL expires when the token expires, even if the URL was created with a later expiration time.

content: Why does Oort DSS recommend using multipart uploads for large objects?
summary: Oort DSS recommends using multipart uploads for large objects because it allows you to upload a single object as a set of parts, which can be uploaded independently and in any order. This provides several advantages such as improved throughput, quick recovery from network issues, the ability to pause and resume object uploads, and the ability to begin an upload before you know the final object size.

content: How do I calculate the cost of 1TB standard storage?

content: When a user wants to retrieve their file from DSS, how does the system ensure the file can be reassembled and decrypted?
summary: When a user wants to retrieve their file from DSS, the system ensures the file can be reassembled and decrypted by having the client-side application request the shards from the corresponding nodes by querying the database. Due to the erasure coding technology, the file can be reassembled and decrypted even if some shards are not available due to node failure or network congestion.

content: What is the purpose of the low credit alert feature in Oort DSS?
summary: The low credit alert feature in Oort DSS helps you manage your credits and avoid service interruptions. You can set a specific credit threshold, and Oort DSS will notify you if your balance falls below that threshold. This allows you to top up your account before your credits run out and avoid any service interruptions.

content: When does the maximum duration of a temporary authorized link in Oort DSS expire?
summary: The maximum duration of a temporary authorized link in Oort DSS is 12 hours. After this time, the link will expire and can no longer be used to access the object.

content: What is the process to create a bucket in Oort DSS?
summary: You can use the Oort DSS console, Oort DSS S3-Compatible APIs, AWS CLI, or AWS SDKs to create a bucket. For more information about the permissions required to create a bucket, see Create Bucket in the Oort DSS S3-Compatible API Reference.

content: What are Backup Nodes in Oort's infrastructure?
summary: Backup Nodes in Oort's infrastructure are deployed globally and utilize the storage capacity of popular decentralized storage networks such as Filecoin, Storj, Crust, and Arweave. All user data stored on Oort is backed up by these nodes, ensuring data durability and resilience against data loss due to hardware or network failures.

content: Why does the Oort S3 console display only the part of the key name that follows the last slash?
summary: The Oort S3 console displays only the part of the key name that follows the last slash to simplify the display and make it easier for users to identify and manage their objects. This way, the console shows the file name as it would appear in a typical folder structure, even though the full key name includes the folder name as a prefix.

content: How can Rclone help in mirroring cloud data to other cloud services or locally?
summary: Rclone can help in mirroring cloud data to other cloud services or locally by providing the functionality to copy files from one cloud storage service to another or to your local storage. This can be useful for backup purposes or when migrating data between different cloud services.

content: Where can I find the option to set the maximum duration of the link expiration when creating a temporary authorized link in Oort DSS?
summary: When creating a temporary authorized link in Oort DSS, you can find the option to set the maximum duration of the link expiration during the link creation process. The maximum duration can be set to 12 hours.

content: Which actions can Rclone help you with?
summary: Rclone can help you with actions such as backing up and encrypting files to cloud storage, restoring and decrypting files from cloud storage, mirroring cloud data to other cloud services or locally, migrating data to the cloud or between cloud storage vendors, mounting multiple encrypted, cached, or diverse cloud storage as a disk, analyzing and accounting for data held on cloud storage using lsf, ljson, size, ncdu, and union file systems together to present multiple local and/or cloud file systems as one.

content: Why is it important to have zero downtime when hosting a website?
summary: It's important to have zero downtime when hosting a website because downtime can lead to lost revenue, damaged reputation, and reduced productivity. With Oort DSS, you can enjoy full control of your data and the easy maneuverability of your custom domains with zero downtime, ensuring your website is always accessible to your users.

content: What are folders represented as in Oort DSS?
summary: In Oort DSS, folders are represented as prefixes that appear in the object key name.

content: Where are the shards encrypted in the Oort DSS process?
summary: In the Oort DSS process, each shard is encrypted on the client-side using AES-256 encryption. This ensures that only the file owner can access the content.

content: Why is it important to follow access control best practices in Oort DSS?
summary: Following access control best practices in Oort DSS is important to ensure the security and privacy of your data. Proper access control can prevent unauthorized access and potential data breaches.

content: What steps do you need to take to restore an object from archive storage in Oort DSS?
summary: To restore an object from archive storage in Oort DSS, navigate to the bucket where it is located and select the object you want to download. Right-click the object you wish to access, click on the 'Restore' button to initiate the restoration process. You can set an available period during which you can access, download, and share copies of the restored object. Once the restoration is complete, you'll receive a notification that the object is available for download.

content: When using Oort DSS for web hosting, when can you expect downtime?
summary: One of the key advantages of using Oort DSS for web hosting is that it promises ZERO downtime. This means you can expect your website to be available at all times.

content: Who is the intended user of Oort DSS?
summary: Oort DSS is intended for anyone who wants a secure, private, and cost-effective alternative to traditional centralized cloud storage services. It can be used by individuals, businesses, and organizations.

content: How can you download a restored object from archive storage in Oort DSS?
summary: Once a restored object from archive storage in Oort DSS is available, you can download it as you would with a standard storage class object. Navigate to the object, right-click on its name, and click on the 'Download' button to initiate the download.

content: Which type of users should not share root user credentials in Oort DSS?
summary: In Oort DSS, it is recommended not to share root user credentials with employees who require access. Instead, individual access keys can be created for each user.

content: Why should I use the provided API methods to work with buckets in Oort DSS?
summary: The provided API methods allow you to manage your buckets and objects in Oort DSS programmatically. The supported API methods include creating a new bucket, listing all buckets, deleting a bucket, listing objects in a bucket, retrieving objects, and more.

summary: If you try to use a temporary authorized link in Oort DSS after it has expired, you will not be able to access the object. The link is only valid until the specified expiration time.

content: When does Oort DSS create an object during a multipart upload?

content: What is the concept of folders in Oort DSS?
summary: In Oort DSS, there is no hierarchy of subbuckets or subfolders. However, you can infer logical hierarchy using key name prefixes and delimiters as the Oort DSS console does. The console uses the key name prefixes and delimiter to present a folder structure. The Oort DSS console implements folder object creation by creating a zero-byte object with the folder prefix and delimiter value as the key.

You can set an available period during which you can access, download, and share copies of the restored object. content: What is multipart upload in DSS?

This feature enables you to upload parts independently, in any order, and in parallel. You can use it to improve upload speed.

summary: The 'rclone sync' command syncs the source to the destination, changing the destination only. It doesnt transfer files that are identical on source and destination, testing by size and modification time or MD5SUM. Destination is updated to match source, including deleting files if necessary.

After you have uploaded all the parts, you complete the multipart upload. Upon receiving the complete multipart upload request, Oort DSS constructs the object from the uploaded parts, and you can then access the object just as you would any other object in your bucket.

content: What is the purpose of Oort DSS?
summary: Oort DSS is designed primarily as a decentralized cloud storage platform. It aims to provide an enterprise-grade, secure, private, and cost-effective alternative to traditional centralized cloud storage services like Amazon S3, Google Cloud Storage, or Microsoft Azure Blob Storage.

content: Show me a python example uploading data to DSS, using boto3 library.
summary:
Sure, here is a simple Python example using the `boto3` library to upload a file to DSS:

```python
import boto3
from botocore.client import Config

# Initialize a session using Spaces
session = boto3.session.Session()

client = session.client('s3',
                        region_name='your-region-name',
                        endpoint_url='https://s3-standard.oortech.com',
                        aws_access_key_id='your-access-key',
                        aws_secret_access_key='your-secret-key',
                        config=Config(signature_version='s3v4')
                        )

# Upload a new file
data = open('test.jpg', 'rb')
client.put_object(Bucket='your-bucket-name', Key='test.jpg', Body=data)
```

Please replace `'your-region-name'`, `'https://s3-standard.oortech.com'`, `'your-access-key'`, `'your-secret-key'`, and `'your-bucket-name'` with your actual region name, endpoint URL, access key, secret key, and bucket name.

This script opens a file named `'test.jpg'` in read-binary mode and uploads it to the specified bucket at DSS. The `Key` parameter is used to name the file when it's uploaded to DSS.

Please note that you need to have the `boto3` library installed in your Python environment. You can install it using pip:

```bash
pip install boto3
```

Also, please ensure that you have the necessary permissions to read the file and to upload files to the specified bucket.

content: Which nodes in Oort's infrastructure are designed to offer scalable and high-performance computing resources for mission-critical workloads?
summary: Super Nodes in Oort's infrastructure are designed to offer scalable and high-performance computing resources for mission-critical workloads. They are comprised of both public and private cloud servers and provide support for compute and database services.

content: What is the purpose of the 'chunk_size' option?
summary: The 'chunk_size' option is used to specify the size of the chunks in which the data is divided for upload. In this document, it is set to 64Mi.

content: Which rate limit is applied to the Oort DSS S3-Compatible API?

content: What is the purpose of the 'HeadObject' method in the Oort DSS S3-Compatible API?
summary: The 'HeadObject' action in the Oort DSS S3-Compatible API is used to retrieve metadata from an object without returning the object itself. This is useful when you want to retrieve information about an object without actually downloading it.

content: How is the storage class determined in DSS?
summary: In DSS, the storage class is determined based on the frequency of access to the data and the latency requirements. Standard Storage Class is a durable, high-performance storage solution designed for frequently accessed data that requires low-latency access. It provides reliable storage for a wide variety of use cases, such as storing application data, logs, and media files. Unlike Archive Storage Class, it provides immediate access to data and is suitable for applications that require frequent reading or writing of data.

content: Tell me how to add files for upload in the Oort DSS Console.

content: Where can you host a website that uses a variety of Oort services often across multiple data nodes or Availability Zones?
summary: You can host a website that uses a variety of Oort services often across multiple data nodes or Availability Zones on a decentralized network like Oort DSS. Dynamic Website Hosting on Oort DSS is best for such websites.

content: Why are objects in Oort DSS stored in buckets?
summary: Objects in Oort DSS are stored in buckets because a bucket is a container for objects. Each bucket can hold an unlimited number of objects, and each object is a file and any metadata that describes that file. This structure allows for efficient organization and retrieval of data.

content: When are all Oort DSS objects private by default?
summary: All Oort DSS objects are private by default. This means that only the object owner has permission to access them, unless they choose to share the objects with others by creating a temporary authorized link.

content: When can you set an available period for the object in Oort DSS?
summary: In Oort DSS, when restoring an object from archive storage, you can set an available period during which you can access, download, and share copies of the restored object.

content: Who is responsible for the distribution of shards in Oort DSS?
summary: The user's client-side application is responsible for the distribution of shards in Oort DSS. After encryption and erasure coding, the shards, both the original and the parity ones, are distributed across Oort infrastructure nodes.

content: What is a bucket in Oort DSS?
summary: A bucket in Oort DSS is a container for objects. You can store any number of objects in a bucket and can have up to 100 buckets in your account. Every object is contained in a bucket.

content: Why does Oort DSS offer a flexible payment model?

content: Whatare Edge Nodes in Oort's infrastructure?

content: How does Oort DSS work as a decentralized cloud storage platform?
summary: Oort DSS works as a decentralized cloud storage platform by splitting files into small fixed-size pieces known as shards. These shards are encrypted and processed using erasure coding to generate additional parity shards. These shards are then distributed across Oort infrastructure nodes operated by individual users around the world who share their unused bandwidth and storage space in exchange for rewards.
